meanings.definition: a machine used to remove the bark, husk, or outer covering from something
meanings.sent1: The decorticators efficiently stripped the bark from the logs.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use decorticators to separate the husk from grains.
meanings.sent3: The decorticators at work made the farm look like a busy beehive.
meanings.sent4: The decorticators hummed along, revealing the hidden beauty of the wood beneath.
meanings.sent5: The sound of decorticators echoed through the forest, signaling progress.

meanings.definition: a person or thing that decorticates
meanings.sent1: The skilled decorticators in the factory worked tirelessly.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the decorticators of old furniture, bringing new life to each piece.
meanings.sent3: The decorticators at the party were the ones who peeled the potatoes with lightning speed.
meanings.sent4: Her hands moved like decorticators, swiftly peeling away the layers of paint.
meanings.sent5: In the world of art restoration, she was a master decorticators of ancient artifacts.
